title: Exponential-logarithmic distribution
summary: In probability theory and statistics, the Exponential-Logarithmic (EL) distribution is a family of lifetime distributions with decreasing failure rate, defined on the interval [0, ∞). This distribution is parameterized by two parameters p ∈ ( 0 , 1 ) {\displaystyle p\in (0,1)} and β > 0 {\displaystyle \beta >0} .
